attributes.action: Save the Roman town discovered next to a motorway in Newington, Kent.
attributes.additional_details:
This complete town site includes a rare entire Roman temple, a road, homes, and many artefacts. 
i newspaper says "Hailed as one of the most significant finds in regional archaeological history, the 18-acre settlement uncovered contained rare coins, pottery and jewellery dating back as early as 43 AD."  
https://inews.co.uk/news/uk/roman-town-remains-kent-newington-motorway-a2-road/?utm_source=fb&utm_medium=fb&utm_campaign=ijp&fbclid=IwAR0lYsYLHCawGgkFhLsr5t5FN-9KTyhiusg80yfSHPUi-y57SPyNb2fujqY
attributes.background: The house builder Persimmon Homes are planning a large development on this site. Whilst it is vital that new homes are built, it is surely a disgrace to destroy this unique part of the history of our nation. If run well by an appropriate organisation it could be a great and lasting asset.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Planning is a matter for your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

If you're not satisfied with the local response, you could contact Historic England who are responsible for the listing of site. You can find out more here:

https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/
